channel.title: My laptop:S
channel.description: Hi when i turn my laptop on i get a box that tells me to type in a password; I remember setting this password a while back, When i turned it on i pressed enter and clicked security enrollment and set a password, I don't know why i did this however i liked it at the time but now its just annoying. Can somebody tell me how to disable this?

item.title: My laptop:S
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Uh, or since he knows the password, he could just turn it off

Read full topic

item.title: My laptop:S
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

There are BIOS model-specific utilities that generate a special code which you enter into the password box causing it to reset.

Read full topic

item.title: My laptop:S
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

It doesnt matter which OS he has its a BIOS setting and I think you will have to clear the CMOS or whatever but I dont know how to do that on a laptop only on my computers that I build which label it on the motherboard.

Read full topic

item.title: My laptop:S

item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

mad_moparscapian:

Hi when i turn my laptop on i get a box that tells me to type in a password; I remember setting this password a while back, When i turned it on i pressed enter and clicked security enrollment and set a password, I don’t know why i did this however i liked it at the time but now its just annoying. Can somebody tell me how to disable this?

Do you have xp or vista? It’s different for both?
Also jw, what type of laptop do you have?

Read full topic
